review: Everyyyyyyyyyone has been to Chili's right??  I hadn't been to a Chili's in YEARS, but we had a gift card so we figured it was time to use it.  We were pleasantly surprised by the improved menu and quality of food.  I got a 6oz sirloin and my husband got a bacon cheeseburger.  My sirloin had a weird looking texture (like pork...which I don't eat) but the flavor was really good!!  I got frech fries as a side, and they've definitely changed their fry recipe--for the better! They were crispy and yummy, not all soggy and oversalted like I remember.  My husband's burger was good too.  Service was pretty good... a few times we had empty glasses and they weren't CRAZY busy.  All in all though, I'd probably go back.. Good food at a low price.  (if you haven't been in a while, give it another chance!)  They're menu looks to have expanded as well!

Appetizers and drinks were great.   Entrees looked like they had been hanging around all day and re-heated for our table.  The ribs were bland, and way over cooked.   The Fajita meat was like beef jerky.

What can I say...I just don't have high expectations when I go to casual dining anymore...and my experience at this Chili's was no different.  I went with my son and it took 5-8 minutes to have our waiter show up.  Keep in mind we got their at 11:15 on a Sunday...not exactly peak dining hour.  I don't eat meat so my chosen option was the black bean burger...it was worse than what I can get across the street at Costco.  The black beans were OK and the broccoli wasn't bad.  But they brought the broccoli out seven or so minutes after my entree.  My son has a grilled chicken sandwich with corn.  The corn was way over "microwaved" and came out hot enough to burn his sleeps if I didn't get to it first. Waiter was making apology after apology for the delayed arrival of the food.  We don't be going back...too many better options and Chili's just doesn't deserve our patronage.

We use to go to Fridays in Plano, but because our FAVORITE bartender CHRIS decided to leave there and come work here, this is now our new favorite place. Chris is an excellant bartender and remembers everything from your name to your favorite drink. He works Sat, Sun, and Tuesdays so I strongally recommend visiting him. :)

UGH!  Before I rant, I will say that I called after picking up our food and the manager said she was comping the whole bill.  I don't know if it got done because it wasn't my card but  I will have to take her word for it. Ok, we were going to a concert about an hour away and didn't have much time.  We used the Chilis app to place a pickup order that had an estimated wait time of 8 minutes.  Since it takes 10 minutes to get there, we thought, GREAT!  Our food will be ready when we get there.   We waited for over THIRTY minutes to get the food.  When we asked where it was, we were told they were packing it up and actually the manager was the one packing it. We are frustrated because we don't think we really have time to eat and not be late for the concert so we rush home to waiting people and hungry children who's kids pizza's were part of the order.  They were they and one other entree were the only correct items on the entire ticket.  We had missing fries, missing sauce, missing sides, the burger had SEVEN fries sitting next to it.  My fajitas came without tortillas, we were missing our appetizer...shall I go on?   Again, the manager was apologetic and said that they were busy and this shouldn't have happened but it did.  It was gracious of her to comp the ticket because of the delay and everything being wrong.

I use to go here all the time when i got off work. It was pretty much the best way for me to relax.  I have never had a problem with my food, everything has always been prefect. But at times stuff there can get kinda of crazy and busy for the staff like they maybe short handed.  I do know that from talking with people that work there they are one of the busiest locations.  On a Saturday night it does get hard to find a place to sit or even park. So i recommend parking in the best buy parking right next door.

I had forgotten that I disliked this place so much and found my self here again tonight.  It had been so long that I figured that just with natural turnover, maybe they would have better service.  Regrettably  it seems to have only gotten worse.  Once again the service was horrible.  We placed our order about 10 minutes after we got there.  After waiting 45 more minutes our food finally arrived.  I ordered a simple burger and when I pulled the rock hard bun off, I noticed that the bacon was burned black and the cheese was dry and crusty.  After waiting 10 minutes for my waitress, I got fed up and went to the hostess stand to request either my waitress or a manager.  Five more minutes later and my waitress finally showed up.  I told her the issues with the burger and she apologized and said she would get me a new one. 15 minutes later the manager came by and apologized.  Five minutes later the manager brought my burger out.  He apologized and said he would take care of us.  He offered a dessert to our kid since he had already finished his meal.  He got an Oreo ice-cream.  After spending over an hour and half at Chili's, and not really getting to eat dinner with my family we were comped a whole $6.95 for the dessert.   Maybe he had read my previous review of this location and figured I was just a lost cause anyway. I wish there was an setting on the Yelp App that would alarm me if I mistakenly walk into this location again.

This has to be the worst Chili's I've been to. The place was a mess, food quality was poor(er than usual), and service was indifferent. I usually find Chili's to be fairly consistent, but this one must've fallen through the corporate cracks.

I used to frequent Chili's quite a bit back in San Antonio, but my husband and I have both sworn to never come back to this location. I think what this boils down to is just poor management because one the employees that helped us was very sweet.  Most of the service is slow and the whole "waiter team" idea I think is kind of silly. Why would you need two different waiters? One thinks the other has already done something when they haven't and the table is left waiting, you feel bad about the tipping, blah blah blah.  The food we received this last time we went was plain nasty. My husband received a tasteless hamburger (how can you mess up a burger??) and felt sick after wards, and I got my usual; the boneless chicken wings. The buffalo wings, which are usually a nice darker orange color with a light battering, came out almost black and completely hard as if they had been sitting under the heating lamp for a couple of hours?? I didn't eat much, that's for sure.  From the sound of other Yelpers experiences this seems to be the norm, so you can't pass it off as a bad day at the establishment. Obviously some changes need to be made. Either way, it would be hard to get us back in the door for the food!

I live in the area and have been to this Chili's on a few occasions. This past Friday night at 7:00pm, I experienced service that I feel to be mediocre at best.  Our party of four was told 20-25 minute wait, which is fine for a Friday evening.  The waiting area was crowded, but we found a seat.  After noticing several main dining tables empty and two bar tables empty, I asked if we could sit at a tall bar top table.  I was told no because there were others ahead of me on the list, so I asked if the others had asked to sit at the bar table - seemed reasonable to me.  The hostess said no, but that they had to keep it open in case one of them DID ask to sit there.  This made no sense to me.  About 15 minutes later, after NO ONE had been seated at that bar table, my party was seated at that table!  I'm not sure what management was involved in making this crazy rule, but it makes no sense at all.   In addition, food service was very slow and we received an apology about the kitchen being behind after two meals came out several minutes after the others. The food quality was very poor and not up to Chili's standards in my opinion.  There is way too much competition out there Chili's for you to be slacking in customer service.  Very disappointed and won't be visiting again.

Chilis is always good for a variety of food- drinks are good as well. I prefer top shelf so I don't get all the mix with a house drink ( margarita)- foursquare deal check-ins you get free chips and salsa or 3rd check in is a dessert. Also if you are on the emails, they send free appetizer and dessert

Not sure what went awry on my recent visit to this Chili's. Service was good, as it normally is, but what's up with the kitchen? Giant got his usual Old Timer and the patty was cooked to hockey-puck state. I tried the grilled turkey sandwich and there was nearly no turkey there. Deli-thin-sliced turkey (yuk), and only about an eighth inch of turkey on it; shredded lettuce, a thin slice of cheese and a single slice of tomato. The bread slices were an inch thick. Each. So what we're talking here is a grilled bread sandwich. Avoid that one at all costs.  Normally, Chili's is an easy decision for go to lunch, but I'm rethinking them after this meal.

Chili's use to be a place I loved coming to as a kid. I grew up on their chicken fried steak. I still love it only I am trying to eat better. I am happy to say they offer a much healthier menu these days and I have tried a few. I have to say they way lack taste.  Chili's is still a great family place but for me the food needs some spice. Just very bland.

We used to come to this location all the time, dine in at times and to go at other times.  The food isn't what it should be and the service has plummeted!  I'm not sure what happened but in the past few months, each time I came to this location, the service was worst than the last.  Last night, I tried to place a to go order online, as I always do, and kept getting an error message that they weren't accepting online orders and that I must call it in.  So I called.  And they put me on hold.  And they never came back on the phone.  Finally, I gave up, hung up, placed an online order for a different location and went and picked it up.  Thank goodness the location next to Stonebriar mall is a COMPLETELY different story because I was almost ready to give up on Chili's altogether.  Food was EXACTLY as ordered and service was wonderful.  I won't be returning to the Tollway and Eldorado location ever again.

A friend and I went in for lunch on Tuesday; there weren't very many people when we got there around 12:30. It took almost an hour to get our food (one appetizer platter and a cheeseburger). When we finally did get our food, my cheeseburger and fries and friends appetizers were cold (you could clearly tell they had been sitting on the pass for a while). She ordered a pick any 3 plate, and only received 2. When she inquired about her pretzel sticks, she was told by the waiter "oh, I'm sorry, we don't have a substitute button for pretzels. They'll be right out." The manager finally arrives with the pretzels and they are BURNT. We were just so bewildered and the whole situation became comical, so we immediately asked for a to-go box. We reviewed the on the tablets at our table, but this type of service is just unacceptable.

I am trying to order online but their website is not working, guess  I will go to Applebee's and order online.  I am giving them one star for this reason.  Is there an issue with their website when using Apple hardware?  If so, Chili's needs to update their IT or get left behind!

The food is great and the service is good too. I sat at the bar for lunch and the bartender, I believe her name was Alexis, was ADD to say the least. She repeatedly asked me if I needed the strangest things, sliced avocado, side of cholula hot sauce...but left my menu and dirty dishes in front of me for the duration of the meal. I don't want it to come across as if she was a bad server-she was attentive and got everything I asked for promptly. Hopefully over time she will gain some server instincts and fine tune.

We went today only because we were next door for a doctor's appt. We were actually laughing at the fact we were going to a Chilis, wondering what we would eat besides the chips & salsa. I'm surprised but happy to report Chilis has stepped up their game. The menu is huge, a bit overwhelming, but everything looked great.  The old faithful veggie burger had garlic peppercorn pickles and a fancy bun with an actual black bean patty. It was delicious. My husband, who is a total hard to impress food snob, had chicken ranch bacon quesadillas and they were also delish. The service was great and the pay at the table option was also very convenient.   We haven't been in years, but we will be back.

The service here is just unacceptable. We've gone 3 times (shame on us) just hoping against hope that the previous visits were random bad times. Unfortunately this place just has bad management, bad training, bad staff or all of the above. The food was overly greased and soggy, the service was painfully slow - as in get up and go get a manager slow. Not just once - every time. We won't be back. Its a real shame. From discussions with our friends in the area this is a n=known problem. I'm hoping the franchise ownership reads some of these and changes management or something encouraging others to try again.

I find that what you get at Chili's is completely dependent on the location. This one is unfortunately one of the worst that I have visited. My temperature of my meal was not where it should have been. My wife had the fajitas which were drenched in what I called grease. When the server came by and asked how things were I mentioned the issues to her and she appropriately offered to prepare new dishes. I know this should be acceptable but to me I have already waited for my meal and ingested some food so I do not want to wait again so I declined.  About 10 minutes later a manager came over. I was fine with everything up until this point. She said the grease was some kind of sauce and perhaps there was too much. This was not a time to be correcting a customer. It was like grease to us. She just came across as bothered. Now, understand, not only have I not asked for anything to be taken off I have insisted that I do not want anything taken off. My point was to give them the opportunity to correct a customer issue and I felt like I was being questioned about my opinion on the quality of our meals. I paid the bill and then this manager came over to me and says she is taking half the price of one of the meals off. Now I am offended. Again, did not ask and insisted that nothing be taken off. We had eaten half the meal. I did not expect recompense.  In essence, this manager failed at her role. She missed an incredible opportunity to take some friendly customer feedback and make improvements. Had she handled this that way, I would likely have been willing to come back and try again because I would have seen a desire to improve and a customer focus. As it stands, I will not return to this location.

Terrible service!!! This place has turned into a feed trough! Not once over the course of appetizers and dinner did anyone ask how we were doing or how the food was. There more concerned that you know how to use the electronic waitstaff replacer on the table so they don't actually have to do any work. It was the last time my wife and I will be back to this chili's.

Couldn't have been any slower. A couple of times I had to wave my arms to attract the attention of a server. When she was there, she was nice, but not very attentive. And the other servers I saw were running from place to place, never looking at tables to see if anybody was trying to get their attention or needed anything. Maybe it's bad management, or maybe they're understaffed? Just odd. Nothing against Chili's--just this store.

My family and I went to this Chilis during dinner. It was a little of a wait but what do you expect on a saturday night. I loved the idea of being able to pay at the table instead of waiting on your waitor or waitress to bring the check. However, you are able to play games also so thats a bonus for the little kids. It does cost a dollar to be able to play. The service was great due to fact of it being a busy night.

Chili's is underrated as a restaurant.  Service is efficient, prices are reasonable, and many of their new menu items are quite tasty.  This is our family "go to" when we want to have a quick meal out.

Just wondering how a training store for all the Chili's in the Dallas area failed twice on their health inspection... Is this where people really want to eat at and the fact they will not post their health score so all the customers will not see it is scary enough.... I witness a server washing a dirty spoon with plain water, then took it to a guest and all I can say is "Wow"...
We like this chilis a lot! Nice friendly service! The food is always good and hot too! Our experience is always good.

Not surprised by a lot of the reviews on here. My biggest problem is this place is so dirty! All the time. I've been in the restaurant business most of my life so I understand that it gets busy, very busy; but when I arrive and sit at the bar in front of a dirty table and that table is STILL dirty, full of food, trash and dishes an hour and half later when I leave...gross. As for service, my boyfriend and I sit ONLY at the bar or service doesn't exist. And unless Mark or Garret are bartending, we leave. The only reason we go back is 1) the food is actually not bad. Depends on what you order and 2) there is almost nothing else to eat on that side of town! Really praying for some other options to move in fast.  Hey Chilis, don't be cheap, hire a busser and maybe you'll pass health department standards.

Its consistent if anything. I have enjoyed the chicken crispers and they have improved over time. My kids love the place though. The drink options are great and I have to say the molten cake is awesome.

I stopped in for a bite to eat. We waited 5 minutes at the front. The place was empty. When the employee tried to seat us she could not. All tables were either dirty or taken. The percentage was heavy on the dirty. She apologized and I responded with hire more help.  Food was ok. Went to men's room. The men's room was as dirty as the dining room. This to me is an indication that management is not engaged. What's the kitchen look like?! Overall this Chilis is sub-par and I will not be returning.

We have been here twice. The first time my husband and I both ordered the Ribeye and it was so bland we actually sent them back. I've NEVER sent back a meal so that says a lot. The second time I got the Bacon Avacado Chicken sandwich and the chicken was really dry. Both times the service was horrible. I watched waiters wipe off tables on to the floor and the floor didn't get swept while we were there. We won't go back and will pay more attention to Yelp reviews in the future.

Stopped in here on a whim after a full day of Saturday shopping in The Colony and Frisco. The wife & I expected a crowd at 9PM, to which this Chili's certainly had. Nonetheless, we were seated within 3-4 minutes. Kudos to the hostess for clearing off a booth right away as opposed to the server doing it. Appetizers of chips and guacamole, along with some watered down red mix of something (not exactly salsa) was okay. The chips were really cut thin, yet we didn't care. We were that hungry, and for $4.99, we weren't complaining. She had water and asked for very little ice on two occasions, yet the server brought back the glass loaded with more ice to sink the Titanic. Again, no big deal, since I was able to take that ice and add it to my mango sweet iced tea. It would just be nice if there was a little attention to detail on a simple request. There was a bit of a wait for the entrees to come out. More like 20-22 minutes. I patted myself on the back for ordering the appetizer. The two of us passed the time away by chatting as well as playing trivia games on a small electronic device that was stationed on the table. I occasionally stole glances at the television mounted on the wall behind my wife, checking the latest ESPN scores (something most wives & girlfriends hate, but whatever). A second server came by to see if the first server was taking care of us, which was nice yet in the back of my mind, I was hoping that she wouldn't steal server #1's table.  The entrees were actually pretty good. I had a plate of the Ancho Salmon, which is a seared chile-rubbed Atlantic salmon, drizzled with spicy citrus sauce and chopped with cilantro & queso fresco. The salmon was served with citrus-chile rice and steamed broccoli. At 600 calories and for $14.99, this entree was just what the doctor ordered, especially this late at night. The wife had a California grilled chicken flatbread, served with sliced avocado, chicken, and shredded Mexican blend chesse. The flatbread comes with pico de gallo, which the wife requested the server to leave off. I think that in leaving the pico de gallo off throws off the flavor some, since the flatbread taste went from its usual outstanding to "so-so." When it came time for a refill of my sweetened mango iced tea, the server (the third one to stop at our table of the night) gave me an unsweetened version, and promptly let it drop on the table with a loud thud. She didn't even gather the now-empty first glass of the version that I wanted. No big deal, yet c'mon now. Show a little more attention to detail and courtesy next time server #3, will ya? At the end of the evening, the primary server came back to the table and mentioned that we could pay for the meals while at the table using the handy dandy device that we previously played trivia games on. This option was well appreciated, and quite prompt. No waiting for the server, no fuss, no muss. I placed a decent sized tip on the ticket, yet felt a bit weird by taking the original ticket that the server submitted to me with the costs. I mentioned this to my wife, to which she noted that payment would be recorded immediately. My concern was giving the impression of walking out without paying, considering that I had the original invoice in my hand, along with the now-printed invoice of payment from the device. The server never returned to the table, so I didn't think about it.  The surprise of the night arrived when one of the managers asked if we wanted a free dessert, since he made one extra (not gonna say no to that one). That was especially a nice touch to the evening. Altogether, a pretty decent time at Chili's on a Saturday night.

Remember when Chilis was consistently mediocre !? I do .  Now we pay out the a&$ for things like triple dippers and get this!  I got a double portion of chicken crisper a and egg rolls . Sorry I ordered a double portion here is what I got!

I don't see the problem here... The menu is kinda new to me but I really like it. Ate at a Chilli 5 times this month already. This one the service was fast and  good. I don't ever have a problem with the food or service at any of the chilli I been too. I feel for some of these servers cause 75% of the time it's nit picking cheap ass customers that have issues that mostly is that isn't the waiters fault. Please know that waiters make $2.14 an hour and they make the rest on tips... Enjoy the place.

Came in for an early lunch at 11:30. Very few patrons. Ordered a salad & Diet Coke. 25 mins later, it finally arrived. Tasted ok but nothing worth $10. I can't believe I just spent $19.50 in the end ($3tip)! What a rip off.

Not bad, went here with my parents the other day. Chilis has some good, flavorful food, I like the honey chipotle chicken crispers best, and the chips & salsa are exceptional believe it or not. Can't really go wrong though. No complaints with this location, it was busy but the server got us our food and drinks quickly. I do feel bad...my parents paid..and only left 15% tip...even though these days I give at least 18 :P.
Love the guacamole and iced tea! Their menu always retains the classics and gets fresh every season!

Pretty bad service, had several different servers during lunch and it took 35 minutes to get our food which were only turkey sandwiches and fries. The fries were lukewarm.  They said they were short staffed, but it seems to be a pretty common thing from my experience.

My daughter wanted Chili's but I HATE this location! It is a 100% guarantee you will receive a rude waiter, poor service over cooked, greasy food!!! BTW after waiting over an hour for our cold food,  the waiter laughed when I pointed out my daughter's food was on a dirty plate!!!!

We tried this Chilis again and the service was horrendous. They were "out of chips" so we couldn't order Chips and Queso and then not 10-15 mins later they walk by with an order of chips for another table next to us. ??? We had 2 servers. Couldn't figure out who was the lead. We also had to ask what happened to our appetizer order? It came out with the food. Bad experience. Need better staff management.

This place SUCKS big time!!!  I ordered a Caribbean Chicken Salad TO GO and when I got home I was shocked.  A tiny amount of lettuce (about 1/4 cup or so) a few pineapple slices, a few mandarin oranges and some speckles of red pepper, no cranberries and some grilled chicken with a tiny amount of sesame seed pasted to the chicken.  This $10.49 meal was not enough to feed a 5 year old kid.   Absolutely disgusting.  And they put some ranch/mayo in a cup in the container......WTH is that for?  This is the worst restaurant experience I have EVER experienced~~~~~

Love this location. A insider tip: the best waiters are on the bar side! I just love the staff here and the food is always good.  My very first time here was not so good. I sat on the dining room side and had an absolutely horrible experience. I started dating a guy who worked for chilis but in the Fortney location and he told me to always sit on the bar side. Better staff and better service. So I decided to give this location a second try. Sure enough, he was right! I can't complain about anything since. And the presidente margs are always spot on!

I don't know why we continue to come to this Chili's location. The restaurant is nice enough, well maintained, modern, open floor plan, the servers are friendly, knowledgeable, and do their best to compensate for a inconsistent kitchen. We order cheese fries, fries with shredded cheese, bacon, green onion, etc..., and it took for ever. Once we got our app, we placed our dinner order, and I swear the food was out before we even finished our app. I ordered the bacon ranch quesadilla with beef, and it tasted really greasy. My wife order the chicken, and said her was equally greasy. The sauce that comes with the dish seemed watered down, and the pico was more or less chopped tomato, no peppers, cilantro, lime, salt, etc... The kids enjoyed their meal, but it's pretty hard to screw up a cheese pizza and a quesadilla. Sadly..., I know we will most likely be back. For some reason our kids like this place.

2 stars only because waitress was nice. Most Chili's have gone downhill and this one is no exception.  Front area smelled like sewage and we almost walked out. Thankfully when we seated they smell disappeared (still in front when we left).  My explosion salad was wilted and warm. Avocado was light brown and horrible tasting. I was sick to my stomach about 30 min after eating.
husband picked up to go last night, onion rings were disgusting and cold, other food didn't seem fresh but at least warm. will not go back! tasted like freezer food.

This location has gotten bad! I always order the bottomless soup and salad. The chicken enchilada soup (my daughters and my favorite) was a watery mess. The ranch dressing didn't even taste as all like ranch. I reluctantly ordered the loaded potato soup and it was delish! All the food in the menu looks and sound delish but it's just not so, sadly!

From the moment you enter the front door the hostess does not welcome you, both of the "very young" people at the host/hostess stand are way more intrigued with their handheld devices than the paying customers who pay their salary. The food quality is ok. It really feels like the host/hostess position needs a total revamp. Customers are treated more like nuisance than the lifeblood of existence. When the bar is set so low from the moment you walk in the door, it's hard to feel special when everything takes so long, tables are not bussed quickly (dirty table next to us was not clean when we walked in at 2:20pm, still not clean 40 minutes later all while host& hostess stand there clueless doing nothing except social networking I guess). Our waiter is trying very hard however seems to not have help from other staff. The only reason we are leaving this review is this is the same poor experience twice now recently. Not sure we'll be back for a third until this is addressed. Now it makes more sense, the host & hostess think they should be eating instead of the paying customers! Seriously! They are now eating at the hostess stand while ignoring customers coming & going!

Usually our service is always good at different Chilis we go to, but our service was terrible this time. By the time we got our drinks, our food was already coming out and the server still never stopped by the table once to see how our meal was. If you are going to give uncooked chips, at least do it in a timely fashion. We were so over it that we chose not to get dessert anymore.

It's Chilis I get it....but to wait 15 minutes in a booth without getting served is a bit on the ridiculous side.  Manager was a least nice and we got some seats at the bar which is better to watch the game.  Food is Chilis food from  Sysco so nothing spectacular.  Disappointed that no one came to our booth to greet us and take our order and had to get a manager involved.

I have been coming to this Chili's ever since they opened as I live very close by. The waiters I've had have always been amazing and the food is just about what you would expect from a Chili's chain. Although I, and as it seems a lot of people, have always had problems with the hostesses. They do not greet people. They don't smile. They do not communicate with each other leading to one group being sat immediately after another is told there would be a five minute wait. Overall they don't seem interested in doing their job effectively, or about the customer. Now on my last visit I decided to respectfully tell a manager about what I though because overall I do love Chili's as I have been coming for such a long time and I want them to do well. Coincidentally the manager that came over to the table was brand new and I felt like I might be overwhelming him, but I went ahead anyway, and it  turns out that he is a "Culture manager" that has been brought in for this exact reason. I told him my concerns and praised the waiters and the rest of the staff and I felt resolved. Upon returning a couple weeks later I thought there had been some but not a total improvement and I saw that manager working his butt off whipping these guys into shape. Anyway, I thought that coincidence was funny, and moral of the story, they ARE working on it and I know they do care and listen to their customers.

If I could give it 0 stars I would. We were served by a guy named Vernon, which I had to get off of the receipt because he never introduced himself. No one came to our table for over 10 minutes, and when he finally decided to come to our table he blamed the other waiter who was working the booths across the aisle from us(who never took a booth on our side) then blamed it on the fact that we had gotten drinks at the bar so he thought we had already been served. Immediately gave him our order and got cold fried pickles and our dinner at the same time. He didn't come check on us, instead his trainee (which is the most horrifying part is he is training someone) came to check on us. We sent the pickles back and the veggie burger because it was soggy and unappetizing. Then as we are waiting for our check the manager came over and we advised him of our complaints. We were comped for the food we sent back,  we never saw the manager again. 2 minutes later Vernon came by our table and reached directly over me, no I'm sorry or excuse, literally leans directly over me to grab the electronic device due to the fact that it was not placed at the right table. This whole experience was a nightmare and I will never return to this chillis again.

New to the area but familiar with Chili's brand.  Found this place to have very friendly and helpful wait staff.  I was there for a lunch meeting.  He had multiple cups of coffee.  He had been to Chili's many times and ordered his favorite buffalo chicken salad which he said was delicious.  I ordered the turkey sandwich with bacon. It was delicious and the bacon was crisp which I truly love. I would order the sandwich again anytime. I'd recommend trying this restaurant if you haven't been to the Frisco Chili's before.

Sitting at the bar right now. The bartenders are very nice but a little slow. Wait...not slow, because they're moving fast, they just look a little disorganized. We ordered the loaded queso. Our chips and salsa arrived first because "the queso takes an extra minute". Well. 14 minutes later, we get the queso, which is congealed in the middle and soft around the edges. By now, our chips (which were super oily) were gone, as was the salsa. Our bartender got us a refill, upon request. We then ordered an app sampler and wings. 30 minutes later, our food arrived ice-cold. I mean, cold. We have 10 years experience in the food service industry and KNOW that food sat to the side of the window for at least 20 minutes. I sent  mine back (because cold wings are just gross). Waiting for new wings...stay tuned.

So the wife and I had a decision to make yesterday, to eat at Chili's or Applebees. We chose Chili's figuring that we could get in and out faster. Bad choice on our part!   Got right to the table and was greeted by the waiter so things were looking good. But it soon went down hill after that. We ordered Chips and Salsa, two waters, and a Shiner. Got the water quickly and then about 5 minutes later got the chips and salsa. I was about half way through my water when I finally got my beer. At that point we ordered our dinners.  While waiting on the food we finished off the salsa and while he was flying by he told us he would bring out a new salsa. I tried to get him to ask for more chips because most of the chips in the basket were small broken pieces. It was probably about 10 minutes before he showed up with the salsa and by that time we had already eaten all the chip pieces and my wife was out of water, and had been for a while. When he showed up with the salsa he said "Oh... I'll get more chips and you some water."  It was about 5 minutes later and he showed up with the chips and water.  We were just about finished with the second serving of chips and salsa when we finally had the manager sent over. It had been 45 minutes since we ordered our food.  (Not since we had gotten there... since we had ordered.) He called on his radio to the back to ask about our food and told us that it would be out in about 45 seconds. It did arrive around that time and it tasted good... but it was not hot, it was just a bit warm. I did not want to send it back for fear of it taking another 45 minutes to get it back.  The table next to us had left and it sat dirty for over a half hour. All in all there were three tables in the bar area that sat dirty for over half an hour and a pile of people waiting at the door for a table. I pointed that out to the manager and he started to clean them. Once he got the tables cleaned he was not to be seen in the bar again. I ended up having to take most of my food home because after eating so much of the chips and salsa while waiting so long I got full. It took them 45 minutes to get us our food from the time we ordered it and we ended up being there for around an hour and forty minutes. That is way too long and not turning over tables has got to be eating into their profits. However, in looking at other reviews on here that may be the norm for this location. If this is a franchise location it looks like Chili's corporate needs to get a trouble shooter out to this location.

My particular interaction was good. I called in a order so my food can be ready by the time I got there because I was on a lunch break. Service was prompt and got my food a minute later. My waiter was a lady named Porsche and she was really nice.

In the 1970's, I used to go to the first, and then only, Chili's near Meadow Road and Central Expressway for lunch with others from my office. We could get there, eat and get back in an hour or so. Today, now retired, I sat for 30 minutes waiting for my lunch of one enchilada, rice and beans and a cup of soup. I had to flag down the hostess to find my server to see if my order was lost. All of this can  be served quickly from a warming table in the kitchen. The food was OK but by the time I was served I was not pleased. Brinker International, the parent company, just laid off 80 people here in the Dallas area due to slumping sales at Chili's. They blame Smashburger and other fast casual restaurants for making inroads on their customers. Note the word "fast." When leaving I noticed that the seat cushion had a one inch cut in it, exposing the inside of the cushion. In the restroom, I noticed that the chrome fixtures were now deteriorated to looking like years of residual scrubbing cleaner stuck forever. The restaurant was half empty with quite a few tables occupied by small groups having staff meetings. The booth next to mine had a manger lecturing two employees regarding "renewals" for the entire time I was there. They only ordered when I was leaving.  The new idea at Chili's is to focus on the bar and craft beers. I guess the restaurant is on it's own.

Me and my team had a reservation at 2:15 and it took an hour to get our food. Our drink were messed up and had things floating in it and the water tasted like metal. Our waiter had a major attitude and took forever to refill our drinks. Overall the service was not good. Do not recommend this place if you're coming with a group. I have also had many issues before at other Chili locations.
Staff lacked in manners and customer service. Food came out very slow and it was cold. This use to be a great place,

Wow, I've had bad service at this location, but never enough to write a review. We ordered online tonight and according to the online order, our food was supposed to be ready for pick-up at 6:08pm. My boyfriend got there, paid, and waited roughly 30 minutes before our food was handed to him. It wasn't until he asked for his money back, that ALL OF A SUDDEN, he was handed our bag of food. No explanation, no compensation for the ridiculous wait time, no apology. The  lack of service at this location is already barely tolerable, but for a pick-up order?!? We will definitely NOT be choosing Chili's as a dining option anymore. Terrible service and clearly lack thereof management.

You make your online order the way you want the food prepared, and they still screw it up. Ordered two Chipotle chicken bowls with different requests on ingredients and they are identical when we get home including the missing dressing that they both should of had. This is not the first time we have an order messed up. I would have taken it back but we live a city away. Come on chefs, please read and prepare orders as given. Chicken was a bit rubbery as well :(
Everything was good. Nice margarita and liked my light meal. Son had Delicious chicken and waffles. Cookie skillet is a great dessert but not tonight. Need to show some restraint sometimes!

The service is getting much better at this location, as is the food. I enjoyed the fresco salad and my daughter loved the margarita pizza. I didn't care for the queso but love their chips and will try the white queso next time.
Enjoyed last visit at Chili's. Food much better than expected. Really good service too.
No a good taste in the food , I went because I had a gift card but the cheese was old, avocado was not fresh price too high for low quality, not going back :

First time here. Ordered Triple Dipper. Had chicken tenders, southwest egg rolls and sliders. The tenders were NOT COOKED ALL THE Way through. Not so sure I'll come back. That's grosses me out big time!!!!

I have always loved Chilis for a quick bite. I had a bad expierence at a different location about a year ago. Since, I was in the area and hungry, I decided to try this location out. I give it 5 stars because of their customer service.  The hostess was pleasant and seated us right away. Our waiter, Victor, was the best waiter we have had in a long time. He had a great personality! He made sure our cups were filled at all times and came by several times to make sure we were doing good. That's  what we call EXCELLENT customer service in the restaurant field. The food was delicious. We ordered 2 triple dipper appetizers with a cheesecake at the end. I recommend  this place and I will definitely  be coming back to this location again.

Really good food for a good price! Chicken and Waffles. That's the craving I was having and started searching out restaurants for chicken and waffles. My last experience at a different restaurant kind of ruined my taste buds for chicken and waffles and I was determined to find a restaurant that would help me get back to my happy place. I know, Chilli's isnt' the first place I thought of either but after a friend recommend I check them out to satisfy my craving I headed over to my local spot in Frisco. I can honestly say I haven't been to Chili's in awhile and really only thought of them as an average restaurant. I will say I was surprised when I walked in the place seemed a little different, they have upgraded some of the interior décor and have put more effort into being a clean & welcoming restaurant when you first walk in. We sat down and our waiter (waiter was awesome .. great customer service always on top of everything..)   stopped by rather quickly which is always good. He took our drink order, water, Dr Pepper and I wanted to try the "Coconut State of Mind" since it sounded really good from the description. As we looked over the menus we started to see a wide range of new meals and enticing food pictures. If I wasn't on a mission for the Chicken and Waffles I think I would have been there for a good 15 mins just trying to decide what I wanted to eat as it all sounded really good. We ordered the Honey-Chipotle Crispers & Waffles with fries on the side and a Grass-Fed Sunrise Burger with fries. Yep, you read that right, Chili's now offers grass fed beef and cage free eggs. Amazing! If you haven't tried a grass fed burger then you are definitely missing out. The flavors are enhanced and the burger is really moist, just a perfect burger. Our drinks were delivered quickly and as I took my first sip I was instantly transported to a beautiful beach on a tropical island, delicious. In fact it was so delicious and enjoyable I had to order another Coconut State of Mind. Our food arrived after the appropriate amount of time for them to cook everything fresh and here's where Chili's has gone to the next step, everything they put in front of us looked exactly like the menu picture, exactly! I can't remember how many places I've gone to that show you a delicious looking food item on the menu and you order it thinking you are going to really enjoy your meal and when it arrives to your table you have instead received either a shrunken version of what you ordered or something that looks like the cook was playing grill hockey with your food and you end up with a jumbled mess. Chili's gets bonus points for presentation!! On to how the food tastes. My first bite was a mixture of crispy chicken, Belgian waffle, honey-chipotle sauce and a little bit of syrup. Absolutely Amazing!! So delicious having the moist crispy chicken with the perfectly cooked Belgian waffle, drizzled honey-chipotle sauce and to top it all off being able to dunk all of it into a side of syrup!! My mouth just went on a roller coaster ride and doesn't want to get off. The Grass-Fed Sunrise Burger was just as amazing!! The beef was seasoned perfectly and the burger was juicy, delicious and the cage-free egg was just runny enough to give you that little bit of yolk flavoring that makes your mouth happy. I really enjoyed this visit to Chili's and have put them on my list of favorite restaurants. They are no longer just an average restaurant, they have moved up to the "recommended list". Great Job Chili's!! I'll be back to try more items from the menu.

Slowest service ever.  When we arrived at 4:30pm, there may have been three other groups of patrons.  Had to ask twice if our meal would be coming out soon.  When a manager finally brought out our meal, I mentioned that it took awhile and all he said was that the cook did it wrong.  They substituted a Mexican rice for the rice that was supposed to be with the meal and it tasted terrible.

Total joke.  We went and were seated and no one bothered to come serve us after 15 minutes.  Called the hostess over and let her know and asked if they were busy she said i and then she proceeded to call someone to sober could get served.  Another 10 minutes passed and nothing.  There were servers (I'm assuming that is what these employees were) just talking to each other not busy at all.  We walked out and that same hostess just kind of said sorry about that like she was reading a script.  There was also a manager who saw all of this happen.  What a joker though seriously.  It may not always be like that but this is a no brainer one star experience no questions asked.

After a long day, my friends and I were hungry and decided all of the sudden to get food from Chili's.  I ordered Cajun Chicken Pasta and ordered corn on the side and omg, it was a happy fulfilling meal!! I first finished the corn because it was just so good but therefore, couldn't finish all of the pasta because I was full haha. But even with the full stomach, I must say the pasta was very good!!  After tipping the waitress, the price was about $20, however I think it was worth the money!!! Would definitely go there again, maybe after a paycheck day or someone's birthday to treat yourself!
Good service. Food was brought out in reasonably time. Refills obtained. Food right. Food good.
Great experience. Great server! Would recommend to anyone! I could eat my weight in the skillet queso!

Never ever again. My wife and I went here for dinner tonight. We arrived before the crowd  but had to wait for the crew to bus a table for us. I ordered a bowl of chili and my wife ordered a hamburger. We waited and waited. On top of that there was a couple sitting next to us with two kids. Their son was screaming and jumping around on the bench seating and kept kicking my wife. The mother was playing with him, dancing on the seat to the restaurant music. We told the waitress we were tried of the long wait for our meal and the misbehaving kids and we were leaving to bring us a check. The waitress said she understood and told us we did not owe anything. The kids were no fault of Chili's - Parents be be consider of others that may not enjoy your kids acting like they have no sense when you go out. Leave them home if they do not have the manners to be in a public restaurant. Chili's,  we will not be back.

We've been here several times, although this is the first review. It's my son's favorite place for chicken strips, and the presidente margarita is pretty good, and only $5 during happy hour.  The skillet queso is decent and we love that they refill the chips & salsa. Makes for a budget-friendly appetizer.   The service is friendly and they're good about refills and clearing plates.  Food is pretty decent, and they have a great variety for families. Plus the prices are good.  4 stars for overall predictable food and service.  CON: The biggest turn-off is every single time we are here the menus are dirty. Like, dried-on salsa dirty.   One star off for that.

Chicken and waffles as a seated guest with paid staff - 5 Stars Curbside pickup of to-go orders...1 Star 1. Staff dont actually do curbside 2. Staff add 30+ minutes to orders to make sure everything is served cold 3. Staff get their tips first and then resist showing you your orders, knowing they are going to expose the lack of sides and the poor quality.  4. Staff effectively tell you to "pound sand" once they have your money, if you question the quality and quantity of the order.

Very disorganized the minute they took our names. They took my name down wrong and we waited an extra 10 minutes until we went back up and asked them. Once we were seated no one waited on us for 20 minutes we sat there until we grabbed someone. They were busy but not really busy. Either understaffed or people that don't really care.

It seems like every time we order at this chilis to go something is left off our order (or is cold) and not once have we received any money back, just get let us know next time and we will get it for you free.  Problem is when you try to order they have nothing documented and just say they are sorry.  So tired of the customer service and lack of quality.  Also the last 3 times we have ordered curbside not once have they brought the order to the car we have had to go in the store.  Chilis seriously needs to consider new management at this location.

Picked up to go. On top of a screwed up order, the food they put in the boxes, specifically the big mouth burger bites, were all over cooked and could have been used as hockey pucks.  Crossing this Chili's off the easy go-to restaurants.
